abstracts.cdata!:
Audit results were mixed, for although
            the project outcome is rated satisfactory, its
            sustainability is uncertain, given the weak economic, and
            financial position of Belarus. In addition, despite
            substantial institutional development, and satisfactory
            performance by the Borrower, the Bank performance is rated
            as marginally satisfactory, because supervision reporting
            was incomplete, and little was done to support follow-up
            funding generation. This is therefore the main lesson drawn
            from this project. During the early stages of the pilot
            phase of the Global Environment Facility (GEF), it was
            implicitly assumed that environmental follow-up funding,
            would supersede the initial GEF input to support maintenance
            operations. However, this assumption proved incorrect,
            therefore, after ten years of experience, it is now
            suggested that GEF should review the possibility to ensure
            long-term support to protect resources of high global
            biodiversity value, considering a broader view of
            biodiversity, and conservation issues. A more general review
            on how to ensure sustainability of globally valuable
            bio-resources, should be raised at the tenth anniversary of
            the Rio Conference.
